answers.answer: I thought I would add that my triglycerides are elevated to around 230 and LDL is low.  HDL is fine.please, if anyone could comment, it would be appreciated.

question: Hello,Thank you in advance for any imput you may have.I currently am being treated for a prolactin producing pituitary tumor, high blood pressure, hashimotos thyroid, type 2 diabetes and vitamin D deficiancy.  I am 30 years old and up until the tumor I was underweight.  I am now overweight at 5'1" 160 lbs.  My blood pressure is around 150/95 and with a very mild medication it has come down somewhat.I have recently been experiencing palpatations which startle me when they occur.  I get slighly light headed and dizzy when they occur and it takes a moment for me to regain my composure.  They don't hurt, they just make me feel very uneasy.  I have been having slight shortness of breath, swelling in hands and feet and inability to lose weight.I am on a medication for my pituitary tumor that is known to cause heart valve problems and other types of heart disease.  My dr. has ordered an echocardiogram because of this, especially after I mentioned the palpatations.Does this sound consistant to a heart valve problem to you?
title: palpatations associated with medication?
